properties.title: Melati - Java SQL Website Development Engine
properties.author: Tim Pizey
properties.keywords: Persistence, Java, SQL, Database, Templates, Object Relational Mapping, Objects, Object Oriented, J2EE replacement

section.name: Installation
section.p: The Melati distribution includes a webserver (Jetty), a database (HSQLDB) and two templating engines (Velocity and WebMacro) so that it works straight out of the distribution with no configuration.

A completely empty database, which instantiates org.melati.poem.PoemDatabase is configured in the distribution.
This can be used as your local desktop database.

subsection.name: Testing
subsection.p: To test your installation and illustrate a few capabilities run through the tests.

subsection.name: Embrace and extend
subsection.p: If you want to use Melati to build a website you might start by downloading and tinkering with the Contacts example locally, you can, of course change the target database and default templating engine.

subsection.name: Maven archetype
subsection.p: To create a new Melati based project use the archetype.

subsection.name: Using ant still?
subsection.p:
To get a complete replica of the Melati website using ant:
cd build ant go

Note that you need a modern version (1.5 or higher) of Ant to use the site html regeneration.
Point your browser at http://localhost:8080/ and you should find you can browse the website.
Further installation instructions are in the README file.
